intro: Sesamum heudelotii, commonly known as African sesame, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Pedaliaceae family and is characterized by its erect, branched stems and small, yellowish flowers. The plant produces capsule fruits that contain small, brown seeds used for culinary and medicinal purposes. It thrives in warm, dry climates and is often cultivated for its oil-rich seeds. The botanical features of Sesamum heudelotii make it an important species in traditional agriculture and herbal medicine.
